title: Prelude to War
description: Frank Capra's documentary chronicles the rise of authoritarianism in Germany, Italy and Japan as America prepares for a defense of liberty.

title: The Battle of Midway
description: Director John Ford captures combat footage of the Battle of Midway, an air and sea campaign that was a turning point in the war in the Pacific.

title: title
description: description

title: Undercover: How to Operate Behind Enemy Lines
description: This World War II-era training film dramatizes how secret agents should act while undercover and how to avoid capture by enemies.

title: Why We Fight: The Battle of Russia
description: This installment of Frank Capra's acclaimed documentary series highlights the need for a Russo-American alliance to defeat the Nazis.

title: WWII: Report from the Aleutians
description: Filmmaker John Huston narrates this Oscar-nominated World War II-era film about life among the U.S. soldiers protecting Alaskaâ€™s Aleutian Islands.

title: title
description: description

title:
The Memphis Belle: A Story of a
Flying Fortress
description: This documentary centers on the crew of the B-17 Flying Fortress Memphis Belle as it prepares to execute a strategic bombing mission over Germany.

title: The Negro Soldier
description: This documentary urged African Americans to enlist and join in the effort to be part of America's continuing fight in World War II.

title: Tunisian Victory
director: Frank Capra, John Huston, Hugh Stewart, Roy Boulting, Anthony Veiller
description: British and American troops join forces to liberate a Nazi stranglehold in North Africa, sharing battles, hard work and a peaceful Christmas dinner.

title: title
description: description

title: Know Your Enemy - Japan
description: Though culturally insensitive by modern standards, this propaganda film examines the history of Japan from the 16th century through the 1930s.

title: Nazi Concentration Camps
description: Shocking footage shows Nazi concentration camps after liberation, including Buchenwald and Ohrdruf, where Gen. Eisenhower ordered local Nazis to tour.

title: San Pietro
description: After the Allies invade Italy, the Liri Valley town of San Pietro becomes an example of the brutal effects of combat, both for soldiers and civilians.

title: title
description: description

title: Let There Be Light
description: Some returning combat veterans suffer scars that are more psychological than physical. This film follows patients and staff during their treatment.

title: Pioneers of African-American Cinema
director: Oscar Micheaux, Spencer Williams, Richard E. Norman, Richard Maurice
description: This newly preserved collection features more than 20 films made by groundbreaking African American directors for black audiences from 1915 to 1946.

title: title
description: description

title: Thunderbolt
description: A P-47 Thunderbolt squadron is shown in preparation, at play and in bombing raids aiming to halt Nazi supply lines and aid Allied ground troops.
